When one considers the precision, with which we 
commonly judge whether the eyes of another person are fixed 
upon ourselves, & the immediateness of our perception that even 
a momentary glance is turned upon us, it is very surprising 
that the grounds of so accurate a judgement are not distinctly 
known, & that most persons, in attempting to explain the subject,
would overlook some of the circumstances by which, it will 
appear, they are generally guided. -
